customize.text: Egeria and the Original Sin

Legend has it that the first of oceans had a composition similar to that of blood, and that life within it was not individual. To set foot upon land or take to the skies, life evolved blood vessels to keep that primordial ocean flowing within itself. The beating heart that commanded this Primordial Sea of blood was the first Hydro Dragon. Each time that heart pulsed, all life would arise and give it praise.
When that first heart was removed, the envoy of Celestia, the leader upon whose shoulders lay the duty to create life, came to the great primeval sea, and there she created another heart, Egeria. That heart had like nobility unto a dragon, but lacked its outer form, and had the majesty of a god, yet was bereft of any divine duty. And though it was created by a ruler of humans, its substance and essence were all original matter from this world, entirely without outside elements. She was the tears that flowed into the primordial sea, seeking communication and understanding, a pursuit which caused her to weep. And it was due to this compassion that she committed all the sins that all beings of pure water must beware.

Egeria created the Oceanids (Lochfolks), elemental lifeforms. Oceanids, admiring the lives of humans, also wanted to become them. Egeria, using the power of the Primordial Sea, turned some Oceanids into humans whose blood flowed with the Primordial water. This creation of people became the original sin of Egeria. Celestia was angry with Egeria for stealing the power of the Sea, so they imprisoned her. A prophecy was created saying: <color=#ffffffd9>"In the end, the people will all be dissolved into the waters, and only the Hydro Archon will remain, weeping on her throne."</color>

customize.text: Egeria and Remuria

While Egeria was imprisoned, Remus arrived in Fontaine and created Remuria. He was predicted to build a prosperous nation and bring civilization and justice to people, but in the end, that very justice would be their downfall. The God King could not abide the dark future foretold, and he decided to find Egeria, imprisoned in Fontemer. In the deepest depths of the waters, the abode of eternal night, the illustrious king learned all the secrets of the Mistress of Many Waters. Egeria told Remus that she had once committed an unforgivable sin, and the resulting curse was also irrevocable. In the end, Remus took the Pure Grail with him on the journey. He promised Egeria to create a world free from the shackles of providence.
In an attempt to escape fate, Remus created imperishable bodies of bronze and stone for his people with blood from insoluble Ichor so that time could not destroy them. The God King created a great Symphony so that every free person could control their own destinies. To bring civilization to the northern "barbarians," Remurian Harmosts led armies of golems to conquer the peoples of the High Sea, but Egeria's followers, the Lochknights, refused to submit. They swore to protect the spirits of pure springs (Oceanids) and other knights from the warriors of Remus. Their main goal was to find the Pure Grail to atone for the original sin and release Egeria from the shackles of confinement.
One legend says that when sin tempted the City of Eternity to its fall, the Lochknights faced unimaginable trials and endured sufferings never before known. But in the end, the heartfelt longing of the people reached the heavens. Then, thanks to their pure hearts and the Pure Grail obtained through countless sacrifices, the Mistress of Many Waters was freed from imprisonment and restored.
Another legend says that when sin tempted the City of Eternity to its fall, a singer named Erinnyes faced unimaginable trials and endured sufferings never before known. Yet, she remained unable to find that Pure Grail. But it was the heavens who chose the Mistress of Many Waters, commanding her to return from her primeval prison to take over from the golden king and rule the sea-ruins.

Whatever the legend may be, when Egeria returned from captivity, she was awarded a shard of that one who was first, and gained both an Archon's right and the divine duty-come-lately. Thus began Egeria's reign as Hydro Archon of Fontaine. In honor of the Lochknights' feat, who witnessed the return of Egeria, the Fontinalia Festival was declared.
Previously, during the reign of Egeria, criminals were expelled to the desert, but some began to ask Egeria for forgiveness, and the merciful Mistress of Many Waters allowed them to guard the secret located in the sea. This is how the Fortress of Meropide came to be. This secret was a passage to the Primordial Sea, which, according to prophecy, was supposed to destroy Fontaine. Over time, the community of criminals grew, and many forgot about the original goal, but the passage to the Primordial Sea remained a forbidden zone.

customize.text: Egeria and the Cataclysm

Millenia ago, Nabu Malikata, the Lord of Flowers, created a "daughter," Khvarena, whose fate was inevitable death and sacrifice. When Nabu Malikata sacrificed herself, she asked her friend, Rukkhadevata, to take care of Khvarena. The Mistress of Grass and Trees turned Khvarena into the divine bird Simurgh, charging her with the protection of two worlds, with the guardianship of the border between new birth and death. When the Cataclysm came many years later, the leader of the realm of water, Egeria, was slain in the Vourukasha Oasis in a battle with the Abyss monsters, and her body was transformed into a sea of pure dew, the Amrita. Then, the Amrita was desecrated by the Abyss, but the bird Simurgh fulfilled its duty by drinking from the Amrita and scattering into many pieces. As foretold, the daughter had to leave the embrace of the "three mothers," Rukkhadevata, Egeria, and Nabu Malikata, to sacrifice herself due to the growing impurity of the world. From these pieces, the Pari were born and protected the Vourukasha Oasis from the monsters of the Abyss.

Rukkhadevata grew the Harvisptokhm tree from the Amrita with the sacred lotus Gaokerena inside. The lotus contained the consciousness of Egeria, so she could hold back the barrier between the human world and the Abyss in the Tunigi Hollow.

500 years later, the Gaokerena lotus became contaminated by the Abyss again. The barrier between the Abyss thinned, creating a phenomenon in the sky called the Sign of Apaosha. Thanks to the efforts of the Traveler, Paimon, the bloomguard Sorush, and other Pari, the Great Song of Khvarena was found and the Rite of Chinvat was performed to purify the Harvisptokhm.

customize.text: Egeria and Oceanids

According to legend, the gentle Egeria shed the first tear, from which the first Oceanid was born. Some say that Egeria felt great sympathy for dragons, and others say she felt great sadness over the eventual fate of humanity. Now, all that we have left is a metaphorical representation whose true meaning remains unclear: <color=#ffffffd9>"The lizard's bones dissolved into mud, from which swans emerged."</color> The newborn Oceanid was bestowed with the task of comprehending all forms of life: to seek an understanding of the diverse array of species and to love every creature. She emerged from the sea of life, possessing the power of metamorphosis. Egeria wished her to use this power to etch the essence of living creatures into her being and she gradually developed a yearning for life. Once it gained enough understanding of humanity, she shed its first tear upon the earth. Oceanids expressed love by merging water bodies together. This way, many minds could coexist without division.
The Oceanids were Egeria's familiars. She once sent them to live in rivers, streams, and ponds all over the continent, and almost all of them were spies for Fontaine. The Mistress of Many Waters wished to connect everyone in the world in much the same way as all water is connected.
Oceanids displayed considerable disparities in cognitive capacity, partially due to differences in lifespan resulting in very different levels of experience and knowledge regarding the world, but substantial individual variation in the Oceanids themselves also contributes to this phenomenon. Some Oceanids were simply too obtuse to complete tasks related to the continent's water systems and are thus confined to Fontaine, where they assist in soothing human emotions.
After the death of Egeria, many Oceanids lost contact with Fontaine. They did not recognize the new Hydro Archon and desired only to keep the dreams of yesteryear alive. Many Oceanids made pilgrimages across the sultry Sumeru Desert to reach Harvisptokhm and see their goddess.

The powerful Oceanid Rhodeia, the most renowned of Lochfolk scouts, fled from Fontaine and settled near Qingce Village in Liyue, dreaming of a small haven of tranquil waters. When she met another Oceanid, Endora, she feared that she was an assassin from Fontaine, sent by Hydro Archon, and so she stretched forth her enmity, which turned the water bitter, in order to slay Endora. Having learned the truth, Rhodeia invited Endora to merge with her and make the waters sweet again, but Endora chose a different path.

The Oceanid, Callirhoe, known as the Spring Fairy, took up residence in the Springvale spring in Mondstadt. There, she met a boy who fell in love with her. Frightened by her feelings and afraid that many years later the boy would regret the time spent with the Oceanid, Callirhoe fell silent for many years.
<color=#ffffffd9>"When the stars in the night sky have all gone out, and all streams and dreams have mingled in the same great ocean... Then, we will meet again."</color>
Only when the boy grew up and became an old man did Callirhoe finally dare to meet him and respond to his feelings by giving her Heart of Clear Springs.

Neither Rhodeia nor Callirhoe wanted Endora to follow their path, so Endora decided to take a path that no one else could take. She decided to go on a journey — to see everything from the flowers that bloom on its banks to the clouds that sit on the horizon.

Another powerful Oceanid, Idyia, having fled from Fontaine, met the witch Alice in the Sumeru desert, and she created for her a world in a bottle, Veluriyam Mirage. In this world, Idyia helped many lost and weary travelers, and when they left Veluriyam Mirage, she created their water projections from Hydro Eidolons so that they would continue to live in her world.

Oceanid Lyris, who did not have such high intellectual abilities as Rhodeia, Idyia, and Callirhoe, was put in charge of the Narzissenkreuz Institute, Fontaine's orphanage, even before the death of Egeria as a sign of her gratitude. It was in Lyris's orphanage that such prominent people for the history of Fontaine grew up as Basil Elton, admiral of the Fontaine navy; Alain Guillotin, the great scientist who solved the Fontaine energy crisis; and Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold, who in their own way tried to resist Fontaine's prophecy and save all people.

customize.text: Egeria and Focalors

Focalors was once Egeria's Oceanid familiar. Focalors always wanted to become a human, since the very existence of a person in her eyes was the most beautiful performance. Egeria transformed Focalors into a human and later chose her as her successor to the Archon throne.

Egeria knew for sure that the prophecy would come true, and that the heavenly principles could not be resisted. She placed the solution to this problem on the shoulders of Focalors. If the theft of the Primordial Sea's might was Fontaine's "original sin," the descent of Fontainians as humans and their right to exist in this world would be Fontaine's "original justice." "Existence" was Egeria's justice, and Focalors continued this principle. Defying the prophecy and ensuring that Fontaine's people shall live on — that should be the authority enthroned over all others.
Focalors pondered for a long time how to counter the prophecy and found the only possible answer: it was necessary to deceive the heavenly principles during the fulfillment of the prophecy. After becoming an Archon, Focalors separated her newfound divinity from her body and spirit, creating Furina. While Furina ruled Fontaine, Focalors accumulated energy to deceive the heavenly principles. 500 years later, when the prophecy began to come true, Focalors was able to use all this energy to destroy her divine part and, accordingly, destroy the throne of Hydro Archon, returning Hydro authority to the Dragon Sovereign Neuvillette. After gaining his full power, he forgave the Fontainians their original sin and turned them into real people.
